meanings.definition: Opposing or contrasting commercial interests or activities.
meanings.sent1: The countercommercial approach to marketing focuses on community values over profit margins.
meanings.sent2: She created a countercommercial campaign to promote eco-friendly products.
meanings.sent3: The countercommercial jingle for the new organic soap was so catchy, it made people dance in the aisles.
meanings.sent4: His countercommercial attitude towards consumerism made him stand out in a sea of materialism.
meanings.sent5: The countercommercial message of the documentary left a lasting impact on viewers.

meanings.definition: A product or advertisement that goes against traditional commercial practices.
meanings.sent1: The company's latest release was a countercommercial that challenged industry norms.
meanings.sent2: The artist's painting was a countercommercial, featuring bold colors and unconventional shapes.
meanings.sent3: The countercommercial for the new energy drink had everyone laughing with its quirky humor.
meanings.sent4: Her fashion line was a countercommercial in a world of fast fashion, emphasizing sustainability and ethical production.
meanings.sent5: The countercommercial on TV stood out with its unique storytelling and anti-consumerist message.
